column1: Granger is a city in Williamson County
column3: United States. It was incorporated in 1891. The population was 1
column4: 419 at the 2010 census. Granger was the site for the 2010 remake of the movie True Grit
column5: as well as an episode of the NBC drama Revolution.

column2: Granger was one of the centers of the large Moravian Czech immigrant population in Texas. This Czech Texan heritage is evidenced by the historic Catholic Church
column4: and SPJST hall. Jno P. Trlica
column5: the son of a Moravian immigrant
column6: set up a photography business here. His photos offer a rare look into the places and people of Granger in the early 20th century.

column3: 36 miles (58 km) northeast of Austin.  Granger Lake is located just east of the city.

column1: The City of Granger is served by the Granger Independent School District. It is home of the Granger Lions.
The climate in this area is characterized by hot
column2: humid summers and generally mild to cool winters.  According to the Köppen Climate Classification system
